meanings.definition: Fogydoms - the state or condition of being old-fashioned or outdated
meanings.sent1: In the museum, you can see the fogydoms of fashion from past decades.
meanings.sent2: Her grandmother's house is filled with fogydoms like rotary phones and vinyl records.
meanings.sent3: At the retro party, everyone embraced their fogydoms and danced to old tunes.
meanings.sent4: The antique shop was a treasure trove of fogydoms waiting to be rediscovered.
meanings.sent5: The dusty attic was a time capsule of fogydoms, transporting us to a bygone era.

meanings.definition: Fogydoms - to become outdated or obsolete
meanings.sent1: Technology fogydoms quickly in today's fast-paced world.
meanings.sent2: His once beloved video game console fogydoms as new models are released.
meanings.sent3: The old software fogydoms, making it impossible to run on modern computers.
meanings.sent4: Like fashion trends, slang terms can fogydoms within a few years.
meanings.sent5: The traditional bookstore fogydoms as online shopping becomes more popular.

meanings.definition: Fogydoms - a group or society of old-fashioned individuals
meanings.sent1: The fogydoms in the retirement community enjoyed afternoon tea together.
meanings.sent2: She found solace in the fogydoms of the knitting club, where age was just a number.
meanings.sent3: The fogydoms of the vintage car club proudly showcased their classic vehicles.
meanings.sent4: In the historical society, the fogydoms shared stories of the town's past.
meanings.sent5: The fogydoms at the antique fair marveled at items that reminded them of their youth.
